searchDlgHtmlBody:
What you want

"I'm looking for the new HR benefits overview. It's a PDF file posted by a woman in human resources with the last name of "Matthew" or "Matthews" - I can't remember which - that features the words "benefits and "insurance" a lot. Oh, and I want the current version, so don't give me the 2015 copy."

How to search this?

"human resources" benefits OR insurance -2015 filetype:pdf author:matt*
  •     Use quotation marks to find files with the exact phrase "human resources", not the separate words.
  •     Use - to exclude any results that contain "2015".
  •     Returns only files that were created or modified by anyone whose first or last name begins with "matt".
  •     Use "OR" to find results that include "benefits", "insurance" or both.
  •     Return only PDF documents in my results.

What SharePoint searches?

SharePoint search engine will look at the current site and its content including pages, news, documents. It will also search for people. It searches full text of documents and their metadata. Metadata includes file name, title, author, and any keywords or category systems you've put in place. Search results only display the content you have access to. Searches are not case-sensitive. SharePoint only returns results that are indexed. Generally, most, if' not all SharePoint content is indexed, but if you're not seeing certain results at all, indexing could be the problem. In that case, ask the IT departement for guidance.

Operators

  • AND
    Limits your search by finding results that include both terms. Searching humans AND resources returns any results that contains both words. A space between words is assumed to be an AND so human AND resources is equivalent to human resources
  • OR
    Broadens your search by finding results that include either terms. Searching "human" OR "resources" returns any results that contain eihter word.
  • NOT, -
    Limits your search by excluding results that include the specified term. Searching NOT insurance returns only results that do not contain the word "insurance". Use a preceding dash to get the same result Searching -insurance is equivalent to NOT insurance.
  • *
    The wildcard broadens your search by returning results than include variations on the term. Searching edu* returns results that include educate educational, education, etc. You can only end a word with a wildcard and you can't use it at the beginning of a word.
  • ""
    Quotes limit your search by returning results that include the exact phrase. Search "human resource" returns results that contain the exact phrase in that order.
You can include multiple operators in a search. For example, this is a completely acceptable search:
"finance report" budget 2016 OR 2015 doc* -2014 -2013

Properties

Search by property to filter by metadata associated with the files you're looking for. Using the same property two or more times in one search acts as an OR.

  • Common properties
    • title
    • filetype
    • author
  • Common operators
    • : - equals
    • <> - does not equal
    • < - less than
    • <= - less than or equal to
    • > - greater than
    • >= - greater than or equal to
You can include multiple property searches. For example, this is a completely acceptable search:
finance report filetype:docx filetype:pdf author<>"John Smith"
This will return any PDF or docx files not authored by "John Smith" that contain the terms "finance" and "report".
